results.title: Celtic tides
results.creator_credit: Mark Hall, Gregory Hall, Nashmount Productions and Cottonport Holdings
results.brief_description: Featuring footage from seventeen recorded tracks as a backdrop, ‘Celtic tides’ takes the viewer on a cultural journey through the origins of celtic music, including interviews with performers, fans and Celtic historians who all share a passion for this vibrant music scene and display a thorough knowledge of the music’s evolution. Individual songs and performers on the tape include: Drunken piper” (Natalie MacMaster and Cookie Rankin), “An Innis aigh (The Chieftans, The Rankin Family), “Theme from Harry’s game” (Clannad), “Ta me mo shui” (Altan), “Flesh & blood” (Mary Black), “O’Neill’s march” (The Chieftans), “Step dance” (The Rankin Family), “Jack Daniels” (Natalie MacMaster), “Brenda Stubbert” (Ashley MacIsaac), “Boxty set” (Altan), “Traditional” (Old Blind Dogs), “A Cur nan goghar as a chreig” (Capercaillie), “Sleepy Maggie” (Ashley MacIsaac), “Caledonia” (Dougie MacLean), “Lady of Shalott” (Loreena McKennitt), “Seamus piping” (Seamus Egan), “E Horo” (Mary Jane Lamond). Hosted by the Rankin family.

results.title: Celtic spirits
results.creator_credit: James Littleton, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: It is through music, rather than through battles or political events, that Canada’s Celtic heritage is explored. Folk-singer John Allan Cameron and fiddler Winston “Scotty” Fitzgerald, well-known Cape Breton musicians, are the on-camera guides and performers in this film about the roots of Celtic music. Against the backdrop of the rugged Scottish Highlands, the misty mountains of Ireland, and at Canadian folk festivals, an impressive array of familiar tunes is performed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Littleton, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Celtic gold in Ireland
results.creator_credit: John Fitzmaurice Mills, Rex Roberts and National Museum of Ireland
results.brief_description: Shows some fine examples of prehistoric Celtic gold work, jewellery and other ornamental pieces, housed in the National Museum. The film also shows some of the places of historical interest where they were found in rural Ireland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Fitzmaurice Mills, Rex Roberts and National Museum of Ireland

results.title: Celso and Cora
results.creator_credit: Gary Kildea, N-AV Productions and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A film in the mode of direct cinema which follows the lives, over a three month period, of a young couple and their two children living in a squatter settlement in Manila. A succession of long “takes” is edited as fragments in the lives of the subjects. Begins with Cora’s attempt to find a new room for the family after they have been evicted from the previous home. Lately Celso and Cora face a crisis in their own relationship aggravated by the stresses of their daily life. Made by Gary Kildea with the local collaboration of Rowena Katalingkasan. Tagalog (Filipino) dialogue, English subtitles.

results.title: Celluloid college: basic motion picture technique
results.creator_credit: Emil E. Brodbeck, Roy Creveling and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: An instructional film for amateur movie makers; includes demonstrations and explanations of panning, using the tripod; shot break down; screen direction; matching; newsreel shooting; build-up; composition; indoor lighting. Concludes by presenting an amusing short play in which all the techniques emphasized in the film are incorporated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Emil E. Brodbeck, Roy Creveling and Sterling Educational Films

results.title: Cellular respiration
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and TV Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: biology”.
These six 10 minute programs use computer animation to illustrate facets of biological respiration. They begin with a historical perspective, and gradually proceed into modern research and theories, examining enzymes, coensymes, phosphorylation, biosynthesis, glycolysis and the citric acid cycle. The programs include: 1. Metabolism 4. Fermentation 2. Glycolysis 5. Krebs cycle 3. Redox reactions in glycolysis 6. Energy flow in respiration

results.title: Cells and what they do
results.brief_description: The story of every living thing begins with the story of the living cell. Through a microscope, children see the parts of a plant cell, parts of an animal cell, the activity inside living cells, the process of cell division, and development of a fertilised egg. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Cellluloid
results.brief_description: Celluloid was the first material used in the mass production of motion picture film. Made from highly flammable Cellulose Nitrate and prone to combustion when running through a projector, Celluloid was replaced in the 1950s by Acetate otherwise known as Safety Film.
